suspicious_activity.narrative: From July 25 to July 31, 2025, Tracy Lewis (ID: CUST_0053) made seven cash deposits, each just below the $10,000 reporting threshold, totaling $67,769.06. These deposits were made at various branches within a short time frame. This activity appears to be structured to evade Bank Secrecy Act reporting requirements.
suspicious_activity.ai_reasoning: The customer has made multiple cash deposits just below $10,000 in a short period of time (July 25-31, 2025). This is a common tactic to avoid triggering mandatory reporting requirements for transactions over $10,000, known as structuring or smurfing.
